channel.title: Please c'mon, it's christmas
channel.description:
Since the begining of november, i've been after this. And considering it's coming close to christmas i'm really hoping for an answer, this will make my day.
You know if you give, you expect to recieve?
I.E: Give a present, recieve a present.
Well this is the same. You give me this, i'll reward you back. And within reason, it will be whatever you want. ([b]WITHIN REASON[/b]).
Ok lets cut the crap. Lol. That sentence above will tell you how it works.
Now for my question.
How can i control the height of mask100var1?
As most of you may know, mask100var1, creates a graphic that is FACING.
It's used in the following method. [code] public void playerGfx(int id, int delay) { mask100var1 = id; mask100var2 = delay; mask100update = true; updateRequired = true; } [/code]
That method says it all tbh..
mask100var1 = id; = Id of the graphic. mask100var2 = delay; = Delay before the graphic is created. mask100update = true; = Updates the mask. updateRequired = true; = Updates char appearance.
Like, if you use that method, to control arrow draw backs, the arrow draw backs come to about weist height.. Just a bit lower than that.. Now i need to make them heigher.. So i can get perfect range :|.. Please someone help..?
Please keep on topic.
Many thanks!

item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

I’m not sure… I’ve been looking in class Player… And i don’t know what creates the actual graphic, and the set height of mask100var1…

        public void appendMask100Update(stream str) {
                str.writeWordBigEndian(mask100var1);
                str.writeDWord(mask100var2);	
        }
if(mask100update)   appendMask100Update(str);
if(mask100update) updateMask |= 0x100;

I’m really confused. Lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Please c'mon, it's christmas
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Ok example, if you use stillgfx(252, EnemyX, EnemyY);

You will get the DDS graphic, but it will always be facing south… ALWAYS…

StaticAnimation(252, absX, absY, 100);

Graphic id, casterX casterY, height.

That also will be facing south… Due to… outStream.writeWord(id);// Graphic id

However, mask100var1, will have facing GFX… (Mask found by Wolf i believe, in class Player).

mask100var1 controls the graphic id on the player. (absX,absY).

mask100var2 controls the delay, before the graphic is created… (absX,absY).

Now i want something like, mask100var3, to control the height, of mask100var1… (Graphic).

If thats not possible (I’m sure it is because i’ve seen it on some servers, whether they have their own methods i don’t know).

Could i create another method, which will do the same as stillgfx, except using the mask100var1? Instead of… outStream.writeWord(id);// Graphic id

Read full topic

item.title: Please c'mon, it's christmas
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Since the begining of november, i’ve been after this. And considering it’s coming close to christmas i’m really hoping for an answer, this will make my day.

You know if you give, you expect to recieve?

I.E: Give a present, recieve a present.

Well this is the same. You give me this, i’ll reward you back. And within reason, it will be whatever you want. (WITHIN REASON).

Ok lets cut the crap. Lol. That sentence above will tell you how it works.

Now for my question.

How can i control the height of mask100var1?

As most of you may know, mask100var1, creates a graphic that is FACING.

It’s used in the following method.

public void playerGfx(int id, int delay) {
mask100var1 = id;
mask100var2 = delay;
mask100update = true;
updateRequired = true;
}

That method says it all tbh…

mask100var1 = id; = Id of the graphic.
mask100var2 = delay; = Delay before the graphic is created.
mask100update = true; = Updates the mask.
updateRequired = true; = Updates char appearance.

Like, if you use that method, to control arrow draw backs, the arrow draw backs come to about weist height… Just a bit lower than that… Now i need to make them heigher… So i can get perfect range :|… Please someone help…?

Please keep on topic.

Many thanks!
